main event: A large, glowing, multicolored object was observed in Van Dyke, Michigan, on August 1, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as similar to a rainbow in color and very bright., The observation lasted five hours and thirty minutes., The object traveled in a southerly direction before fading out of sight., The sighting was supported by ground radar and air visual sources., Astronomical explanations such as Mars and inversion layers were considered as possible reasons for the sighting.
